reviewText: The movie centers around a wealthy young girl who takes in a homeless man (Mickey Rooney) during the Christmas Holidays.  A bond of friendship and trust grows between them that results in both of their lives being dramatically changed.  However, when a secret from the man's past surfaces, he returns to the streets without any goodbye or explanation to the young girl or her family.  Will an unexpected Christmas miracle heal all troubles?  Although the story and ending are pretty predictable, it is overall an enjoyable family friendly movie.

reviewText: Johnny Mathis singing some of the greatest holiday songs, wearing Christmas sweaters and scarves, standing in plastic snow (probably in the middle of the summer) surrounded by actors paid to look happy to be there...what could be more fun?  The "fake" look of the production brings to mind so many of those old TV Christmas specials from the 60s and 70s and it's that very dated look that makes this DVD all that more appealing and endearing.  It's Christmastime, it's Mathis looking great and sounding great and it's priced right.  Unbeatable.  Perfect for background at a holiday get-together.  Only complaint:  not long enough.  Wish it had been twice as long!  Merry Christmas!
Title: N/A

reviewText: VCI Entertainment presents "HOME FOR CHRISTMAS" (1990-TV) (96 min/Color) (Dolby digitally remastered) --- An endearing story with 89 year old veteran actor Mickey Rooney who still has what it takes --- His performance is as always superb, with teary eyed moments in some of his scenes --- Very believable as a homeless man who gives his all to others that are in the same boat he's in --- As we watch the story unfold we are reminded that we are blessed with many things taken for granted, but  there are others who are less fortunate on this planet --- Rooney still has the magic that has kept him and his craft alive all these years --- Recommend this to anyone who has the slightest inclination to help others in need during this holiday season -- or 365 days of the year.BIOS:1.  Mickey Rooney  (aka: Joseph Yule Jr.)Date of Birth:  23 September 1920 - Brooklyn, New YorkDate of Death:  Still LivingSPECIAL BONUS FEATURESTRAILERS:1.  A CHRISTMAS CAROL (Alastair Sim as Ebenezer Scrooge)2.  I'LL BE SEEING YOU (Ginger Rogers, Joseph Cotton & Shirley Temple)Hats off and thanks to Robert Blair and his staff at VCI Entertainment --- VCI was named in Variety and Hollywood Reporter as the first company to produce and release motion pictures directly to the home marketplace --- order your copy now from Amazon where there are plenty of copies available on DVD, stay tuned once again for top notch releases --- VCI are experts in releasing long forgotten films and treasures to the collector -- looking forward to more Nostalgic Collections.Total Time: 96 min on DVD ~ VCI Entertainment #8564 ~ (11/03/2009)
summary: "Home For Chrismtas (1990) ... Mickey Rooney ... VCI Ent. (2009)"

reviewText: First of all I like Mickey Rooney movies and I like holiday movies, but despite the positive reviews I read here by others (who must have fallen asleep during watching it),..This movie is a real dud.  Corny story line. Poor acting by unknown actors...The final scene cracks me up...Mickey Rooney sits there looking like -why did I did I get involved in this?  The best movie Mickey did was "It Came Upon the Midnight Clear" with Scott Grimes and Lloyd Nolan...Possibly Lloyd Nolan's final film? A great Christmas movie, well done. But guess what..It's un-available on DVD! The owners of It Came Upon the Midnight Clear could be making a fortune over the holidays if they were smart enough to release it on DVD. I don't know why Mickey Rooney did one excellent Xmas movie and then did a stupid movie "Home For Christmas"? I tried to think of someone to give it away to...But I wouldn't want to waste anyone else's time and them think "This stinks"? So I threw it away. The best Xmas movies are the made for TV films...Don't waste your money on this bomb. Do see "It Came Upon the Midnight Clear" if you ever can find it.

reviewText: While to a certain degree, I would say that it would have been nicer if JOHNNY MATHIS had recorded most/all these songs uniquely here as TONY BENNETT did on his christmas video back in the mid-1990's (A FAMILY CHRISTMAS), this is still a big 'five' star DVD and the lyp-synching really doesn't get in the way. With many of these songs having actually been recorded back in the late 1950's, you get that old christmas 'crooner'sound that you hardly get nowadays in christmas music.Wonderful versions of songs such as I'LL BE HOME FOR CHRISTMAS (perhaps the best version of the song ever), TOYLAND, IT'S BEGINNING TO LOOK A LOT LIKE CHRISTMAS, and every single other song and along with wonderful christmas scenery throughout with JOHNNY and others presenting different aspects of christmas, you'll be in for a very beautiful and warm christmas treat that is great for you and your household.Highly recommended.
summary: A Very Beautiful And Warm Christmas Offering
